trial_identification.studytitle: Manual therapies for osteoarthritis: A pilot study
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Massage and joint mobilisation for improving quality of life in people with osteoarthritis: A pilot study

interventions.interventions:
Intervention groups: massage adjunct to usual care, joint mobilisation adjunct to usual care
Duration: 10 weeks (one Victorian school term) Frequency of intervention: one session (approx 40 minutes) per week Three group comparison of the effects of usual care with 2 types of manual therapy adjunctive to usual care on the health-related quality of life of people with osteoarthritis.

primaryOutcome.outcome:
Pain: measured using short-form McGill Pain Questionnaire, returns scores for sensory pain, affective pain, total pain, present pain index, and visual analogue pain scale.
Primary timepoint week 9 of 10 week intervention.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measures taken at baseline, week 5, week 9

primaryOutcome.outcome:
Arthritis-specific quality of life, measured using the Arthritis Impact Measurement Scales version 2 (AIMS2).
Primary timepoint week 9 of 10 week intervention.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measures taken at baseline, week 5, week 10

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured using the Medical Outcomes Study 36-Item health survey (SF-36).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Returns scores on 9 quality of life domains.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Secondary timepoints, baseline, week 5 of 10 week intervention. (Measures taken at baseline, week 5, week 9).

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Able to walk 20 metres unaided, able to dress / undress self, able to read / write in English.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Substantive co-morbidity, development / diagnosis of co-morbidity during intervention period.

trial_design.designfeatures: Pilot study of small sample size - results intpretted in terms of clinically meaningful effect sizes rather than statistical significance.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: First study in a series of three pilot clinical trials. Three way comparison of the effects of 2 manual therapies adjunctive to usual care with usual care alone on health-related quality of life in people with osteoarthritis. Study is complete. Trial registration is required in order to publish a report of the trial in a journal.
